term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - hydrodynamically equivalent sphere in polymers
term.title: hydrodynamically equivalent sphere

item.text: A hypothetical sphere, impenetrable to the surrounding medium, displaying in a hydrodynamic field the same frictional effect as an actual polymer molecule. The size of a hydrodynamically equivalent sphere may be different for different types of motion of the macromolecule, e.g. for diffusion and for viscous flow.
